participant_1.background: I am a fourth child who was once lucky enough to swim with manta rays. I'm not sure if my family would be accepting of me, but I hope they would be. i used to be able to run really fast. My favorite TV shows are usually medical dramas or comedies, because they're relatable to my job and help me relax. i enjoy playing guitar and video games.

participant_2.name: Emily
participant_2.personality: Reflective and sensitive, often expressing emotions through music and cherishing memories of loved ones.
participant_2.background: My worst fear came true when my dog died last year. the future scares me. my suspenders sometimes make my shoulders hurt. my husband is a firefighter. I hope my family will understand that I need to make time for my music.

content.text: Hi! My dog died last year and it was really tough.
Oh no, I'm so sorry to hear that. What kind of dog was it?
A golden retriever named Buddy. He was a great dog.
He sounds like a great dog. What was your favorite thing about him?
He was always so happy to see me. He was just the best friend anyone could ask for.
I'm sure he was. I can't imagine losing my dog.
It's been really tough. But I'm trying to focus on the good memories we had together.
That's the best thing to do. I know it's hard, but he'll always be with you in your heart.
Thanks. I'm glad I met you. I needed to talk about him today.
I'm glad I could help. And I'm here if you need to talk again.
